block.p: Catherine Elaine Graetzer, a daughter of MaryAlice Graetzer and Prof. Reinhard Graetzer of State College, Pa., was married yesterday to David Gruskoff Leibowitz, a son of Eileene and Bob Leibowitz of Manhattan. Patrick T. Perkins, the bishop of the Third Ward of the Mormon Church in Manhattan, performed a nondenominational ceremony at Bouterin, a Manhattan restaurant.

Ms. Graetzer, 35, is keeping her name. She is a supervising editor in Manhattan in the school division of McGraw-Hill, the publisher. She graduated from New York University. Her father retired as an associate professor of physics at Pennsylvania State University in State College. Her mother is a violinist.

Catherine Elaine Graetzer, a daughter of MaryAlice Graetzer and Prof. Reinhard Graetzer of State College, Pa., was married yesterday to David Gruskoff Leibowitz, a son of Eileene and Bob Leibowitz of Manhattan. Patrick T. Perkins, the bishop of the Third Ward of the Mormon Church in Manhattan, performed a nondenominational ceremony at Bouterin, a Manhattan restaurant.

Ms. Graetzer, 35, is keeping her name. She is a supervising editor in Manhattan in the school division of McGraw-Hill, the publisher. She graduated from New York University. Her father retired as an associate professor of physics at Pennsylvania State University in State College. Her mother is a violinist.

Mr. Leibowitz, 41, manages the Web site for the Government Securities Clearing Corporation in Manhattan, which processes and settles trades of government notes and bonds. He received a bachelor's degree from Brooklyn College and a master's in performance practice from its Conservatory of Music. His mother retired as the principal of Public School 276 in Brooklyn. His father is the president of BEL Productions, a manufacturer of clothing labels in Manhattan.
The couple met in 1992 when the bride, who is a violist, joined the New York Repertory Orchestra, which the bridegroom conducts.
